prtsrc.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002                                                                            
00003   PrintSource:  Prints the text of a PDS label with line numbers.
00004                 Note: For this routine to work properly, the source
00005                 label must end in the standard PDS fashion: with the
00006                 word END (in all uppercase) at the beginning of a
00007                 line followed immediately by a new line.
00008   Input:
00009          source_file  - Pointer to the file descriptor for the file
00010                         containing the label to be printed.
00011          first_line   - First line number to be printed.
00012          last_line    - Last line number to be printed.
00013 
00014   Output:  No function value is returned.  The text of the label with
00015            line numbers is printed using output routine ODLPrintStmt.
00016 
00017   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00018 
00019   Creation Date: 13 March 1991
00020   Last Modified: 18 May 1991
00021 
00022   History:
00023 
00024   Creation - This routine was introduced in Version 2.1 of the ODLC library.
00025 
00026   Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00027     a) Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00028        in odldef.h.
00029     b) Corrected argument declarations from FILE to FILE *.
00030     c) Added include file oldinter.h and remove prototypes of ODL functions
00031 
00032   Version 2.3 - 6 February 1992 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00033     a) changed to use long ints due to PC bug
00034 
00035 ****************************************************************************/
00036 
00037 
00038 #include "odldef.h"
00039 #include "odlinter.h"
00040 
00041 /* The following define the maximum number of characters in a source line,
00042    the width of the line number, and the maximum length of an output line */
00043 
00044 #define  MAXSRCLINE 132
00045 #define  LINOWIDTH  5
00046 #define  MAXOUTLINE MAXSRCLINE+LINOWIDTH+1
00047 
00048 
00049 void PrintSource (
00050 
00051 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BEGIN CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00052 /* >>>>> MDD 4/30/91  Changed FILE to FILE *                       >>>>> */
00053 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00054 
00055        FILE  *source_file,
00056 
00057 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> END OF CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00058 
00059        long   first_line,
00060        long  last_line)
00061 {
00062   char  src_line[MAXSRCLINE]; /* Buffer to hold input line of the label   */
00063   char  out_line[MAXOUTLINE]; /* Buffer to hold output line               */
00064   long   line_no;              /* Line number                              */
00065 
00066   line_no = 0;
00067 
00068   while (fgets (src_line, MAXSRCLINE, source_file) != NULL)
00069     {
00070       /* Increment the line number, convert it to a character string
00071      representation and place in line buffer */
00072 
00073       line_no++;
00074       if (line_no > last_line)
00075     {
00076       break;
00077     }
00078       else if (line_no >= first_line)
00079     {
00080       sprintf (out_line, "%0*ld %s", LINOWIDTH, line_no, src_line);
00081       ODLPrintStmt (out_line);
00082     }
00083 
00084       /* See if we have hit the END statement yet and if so, stop
00085      processing */
00086 
00087       if (strcmp (src_line, "END\n") == 0)
00088     {
00089       break;
00090     }
00091     }
00092 
00093   return;
00094 }
